meanings.definition: A timepiece with a stopwatch function.
meanings.sent1: My new chronograph helped me time my running laps accurately.
meanings.sent2: I used the chronograph on my watch to time how long it took me to finish the race.
meanings.sent3: The chronograph on my wristwatch made me feel like a professional athlete.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a chronograph, capturing every moment with precision.
meanings.sent5: The chronograph beeped loudly as it marked the end of the time trial.

meanings.definition: A device for recording time intervals with great accuracy.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a chronograph to measure the exact duration of the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The chronograph in the lab was essential for tracking the time of each reaction.
meanings.sent3: The chronograph beeped so many times, it sounded like a symphony of time.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a chronograph, meticulously recording every detail of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The chronograph's precision was unmatched, making it the perfect tool for the job.
